Detailed Description

The Phone Events Interface.

Events

The interfaces in this group are used to retrieve or flush events, whose type are DTMF, hook (SLIC/DAA), energy, DECT, FAX/Modem, RFC2833, and DSP.
We also provide a 'fd' named g_VoIP_Mgr_FD to help select() waiting for events, and call manager (e.g. SIP) can use it to handle events quickly.

There are two sets of interfaces, and main difference is usage convention that retrieves events centrally or distributively.
In case of central usage convention, call manager retrieve events in its main loop, and do reaction to an event.
In case of distributive usage convention, a certain state uses interfaces to retrieve desired events. A scenario may be:

  • 1. Standby state: Only wait for off-hook event.
  • 2. Dialing state: Only wait for DTMF events to dial.
  • 3. Conversation state: Only wait for on-hook event.
In fact, our kernel implement central usage convention, and distributive one is a set of wrapper to be compatible with older interfaces. Thus, one should decide to choose one according to call manager architecture.
Two sets of functions are summarized as following:

  1. central usage convention
    • rtk_GetVoIPEvent
    • rtk_FlushVoIPEvent
  1. distributive usage convention
    • rtk_GetSlicEvent
    • rtk_GetDaaEvent
    • rtk_GetDectEvent
    • rtk_GetDspEvent
    • rtk_SetFlushFifo

SLICEVENT *  pval

Get the SLIC state.

Parameters

pvalThe SLIC state. Please refer to SLICEVENT for more detail states.
Return values

Examples:
caller_id.c.
int32 rtk_ProcessFxsEvent ( uint32  chid,
VoipEventID  evt,
SIGNSTATE *  pval 
)

Process FXS event.

This API does some additional DSP settings and translate kernel Event to app Event.
Event translater is more like a Event wraper for upper application.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
evtThe Voip event ID. Please refer to VoipEventID for more detail states.
pvalThe phone state. Please refer to VoipEventID for more detail states.
Return values
0Success
See Also
rtk_OffHookAction, rtk_OnHookAction

int32 rtk_GetDspEvent ( uint32  chid,
uint32  mid,
VoipEventID *  pEvent,
uint32 *  pData 
)

Retrieve DSP Event, such as tone end event, caller ID end event.

Parameters
chidChannel ID
midMedia ID
*pEventThe DSP Event.
*pDataThe DSP Data. If event is '0', it means data is NOT meaningful.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
caller_id.c, and rtp.c.
int rtk_SetFlushFifo ( uint32  chid)

Flush the VoIP kernel used FIFO.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
caller_id.c, conference.c, custom_tone.c, fxo.c, fxs.c, and phone.c.
